entry.title: Invesco, WisdomTree, Valkyrie Left Hanging as SEC Delays Bitcoin ETF Ruling
entry.summary: Although the cryptocurrency market has significantly developed over the past few years, the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) still uses the same tactics it employed almost five years ago. The institution has once again postponed its decision on approving spot Bitcoin exchange-traded funds (ETFs). Even the recent court ruling challenging its position has not changed the institution's stance. SEC (Once Again) Postpones Decision on Spot Bitcoin ETFs Initially scheduled for next week, the new decision dates for applications from Invesco, WisdomTree, and Valkyrie have been extended to mid-October. This development comes close to a federal appeals court ruling, which ordered the SEC to reconsider an application from Grayscale Investments for a similar product. Two d‚Ä¶

The researcher‚Äôs thread, released earlier today, alleges that Ryoshi had connections with Vitalik Buterin, a Binance developer, Wanxiang, and even the Chinese Communist Party (CCP) more than two years before the Shiba Inu token (SHIB) was launched.
BoringSleuth teased the thread already yesterday and tweeted: ‚ÄúThread coming tonight showing Shiba Inu Creator was Connected to Vitalik Buterin, Binance Dev, Wanxiang, and the largest Crime Org On-Chain, over 2 YEARS prior to SHIB being launched.‚Äù

Binance Seeks to Ease Remittances in Latam With ‚ÄòSend Cash‚Äô On Tuesday, Binance announced the launch of ‚ÄòSend Cash,‚Äô a new service that seeks to ease the burden of Latam crypto users trying to send remittances to friends and family in Latam. entry.title: US Lawmaker: Americans Don‚Äôt Need CBDC That Can Track Purchases Like China‚Äôs Digital Yuan
entry.summary:
Several lawmakers have expressed concerns about the privacy risks of the Federal Reserve issuing a central bank digital currency (CBDC). ‚ÄúAmericans have a right to financial privacy,‚Äù one congressman said, emphasizing: ‚ÄúWe do not need a CBDC that can track your purchases like China does with their digital yuan.‚Äù Another noted: ‚ÄúCBDC is to sound money what dictatorship is to freedom.‚Äù
‚ÄòAmericans Have a Right to Financial Privacy‚Äô
Multiple U.S. lawmakers have warned against the issuance of a central bank digital currency (CBDC) by the Federal Reserve. Congressman French Hill (R-AR), chairman of Congress‚Äô Digital Assets Subcommittee, wrote on social media platform X on Wednesday:
Americans have a right to financial privacy. We do not need a CBDC that can track your purchases like China‚Ä¶

entry.title: Biden‚Äôs Regulators Urged to Work With Congress on Crypto Regulation
entry.summary:
A number of U.S. lawmakers have urged regulators, including the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), to work with Congress on crypto regulation. ‚ÄúChair Gensler‚Äôs regulation by enforcement is unlawful and does nothing to protect consumers. It‚Äôs time for Biden‚Äôs regulators to work with Congress to provide clear rules of the road and robust consumer protections through legislation,‚Äù said the House Financial Services Committee.
Lawmakers Urge Regulators to Work With Congress on Crypto Regulation
After the U.S. Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia Circuit ruled in favor of crypto asset manager Grayscale Investments against the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), a number of lawmakers have urged regulators to collaborate with Congress on cryptocurrency regulation.‚Ä¶

entry.title: FTX Co-Founder‚Äôs Trial To Feature High-Priced Expert Witnesses Earning $1,200 An Hour
entry.summary:
Per a Bloomberg Law report, in an upcoming fraud trial scheduled for October, FTX co-founder Sam Bankman-Fried is preparing to call seven expert witnesses, potentially paying them up to $1,200 an hour, to testify on his behalf.¬†
According to a letter filed in federal court in Manhattan, these witnesses would testify on campaign finance laws, valuations of FTX and its affiliate Alameda Research, and the crypto exchange‚Äôs software infrastructure and terms of service.
The move sheds light on Bankman-Fried‚Äôs defense strategy as he faces allegations of orchestrating a multibillion-dollar fraud.¬†
FTX Co-Founder‚Äôs Defense Takes Shape
According to Bloomberg Law‚Äôs report, prosecutors already have a group of Bankman-Fried‚Äôs former friends and colleagues ready to testify against him. Howeve‚Ä¶

entry.title: SEC Delays BlackRock, Fidelity, And Other's Spot Bitcoin ETF Applications
entry.summary:
The SEC has just delayed BlackRock, Fidelity, WisdomTree, Invesco & Galaxy, VanEck, Bitwise, and Valkyrie's spot Bitcoin ETF applications, as first reported by Bloomberg ETF analysts James Seyffart and Eric¬†Balchunas.
This was the first SEC decision deadline in the listing process for these applicants since filing, with the delays pushing these applications back another 45 days. The next bulk of deadlines are being slated for the middle of October.¬†
Image Source: James Seyffart
Earlier this week, Grayscale won its lawsuit with the SEC, resulting in the DC Circuit court of appeals vacating the SEC's denial of Grayscale's $GBTC conversion into a spot Bitcoin ETF. This means it will be¬†sent back to the SEC, in which now the commission has 45 days to appeal and file for an en banc hearing, if they wish to do so.¬† While this victory in court does not mean GBTC is automatically being converted to a spot Bitcoin ETF, this ruling does help bring us one step closer to one being approved by the SEC.¬†Because the U.S. court of appeals shot down the SEC's reasonings for denying Grayscale's application, stating, "The Commission neither disputed Grayscale's evidence that the spot and future markets for bitcoin are 99.9% correlated, nor suggested that market inefficiencies or other factors would undermine the correlation...The Commission‚Äôs unexplained discounting of the obvious financial and mathematical relationship between the spot and futures markets falls short of the standard for reasoned decision making." Yesterday, Bloomberg analysts¬†Seyffart¬†and¬†Balchunas¬†upped their approval odds by the SEC for a spot Bitcoin ETF to 75% by the end of this year, and to 95% by the end of 2024. More information on the U.S. spot Bitcoin ETF race can be found here.

entry.title: Nexo Mastercard Adds Credit and Debit Toggle to Optimize Crypto Usage
entry.summary:
Nexo has introduced a new ‚ÄúDual Mode‚Äù feature on its cryptocurrency Mastercard, allowing users to switch between debit and credit functions to optimize cryptocurrency spending.
Nexo Unveils Dual Mode Card Capabilities to Streamline Crypto Payments
Nexo‚Äòs new feature enables real-time toggling between modes within the Nexo app, providing flexibility based on users‚Äô budgets and purchase needs, according to the company‚Äôs announcement on Thursday. Nexo said the newly launched service enhances the capabilities of its cryptocurrency card.
‚ÄúThe Nexo Card embodies the pinnacle of customer-centric innovation, cultivated from user-driven needs that Nexo has been diligently addressing over the years,‚Äù Nexo co-founder and managing partner Antoni Trenchev told Bitcoin.com News. ‚ÄúBy bringing the pioneering Nexo Card with the Dual Mode capability to market, Nexo has further strengthened its position as a leading innovator in the crypto space,‚Äù Trenchev added.
First introduced in 2022, the Nexo card was developed with Mastercard and Dipocket. With Dual Mode, the Mastercard offers different functions based on the user‚Äôs needs, according to Nexo. The company‚Äôs announcement further details that users can earn interest on their balance and make free ATM withdrawals up to ‚Ç¨10,000 per month.
Crypto debit cards first emerged around 2016, with early providers like Wirex and Bitpay issuing Visa and Mastercard-brand products. Their popularity has grown as cryptocurrencies have become more mainstream. Over the years, these cards have provided a convenient way to utilize crypto for daily purchases without having to cash out.
What do you think about Nexo‚Äôs Dual Mode feature? Share your thoughts and opinions about this subject in the comments section below.

entry.title: 7 Spot Bitcoin ETFs Face Extended Wait as SEC Seeks Deeper Analysis
entry.summary:
The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has deferred decisions on seven spot bitcoin exchange-traded fund (ETF) applications from Invesco Galaxy, Wisdomtree, Bitwise, Vaneck, Fidelity‚Äôs Wise Origin, Blackrock, and Valkyrie. In statements released on Thursday, the SEC underlined the necessity for a more extended timeframe to thoroughly assess the submitted propositions.
SEC Delays Spot Bitcoin ETF Decision for 7 Major Applicants
On August 31, the U.S. securities overseer resolved to postpone its verdict in order to allocate a lengthier period for scrutinizing the proposed rule amendments for seven distinct spot bitcoin ETFs.
The regulator elaborated that this step ensures ample time for the SEC to meticulously examine the proposal and address any worries raised.

entry.title: SEC Delays WisdomTree‚Äôs Spot Bitcoin ETF Application Alongside Others
entry.summary:
In a move widely anticipated by industry experts, the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has announced a delay in the review process for WisdomTree‚Äôs spot Bitcoin (BTC) exchange-traded fund (ETF) application.¬†
Seven Bitcoin Spot ETF Applications Stalled by SEC Delays
According to James Seyffart, Bloomberg‚Äôs ETF expert, the delay in the review process may extend for an additional 45 days.¬†
This delay is part of a series of postponements affecting multiple ETF applications, including those submitted by Invesco and Galaxy Digital.¬†
Even Valkyrie Funds‚Äô application, which was originally due on Monday, is subject to this delay. In total, seven ETF applications are expected to experience delays today.

entry.summary:
Popular pro-XRP lawyer John E. Deaton has weighed in on the ongoing court case between the United States Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) and the Coinbase cryptocurrency exchange.
In June, the US securities regulator launched a lawsuit against Coinbase, accusing the exchange of running an ‚Äúunregistered securities exchange, broker and clearing agency.‚Äù
On August 4, Coinbase responded to these charges with a motion to dismiss. The defendants claimed their exchange offered no securities and thus does not operate under the SEC‚Äôs jurisdiction.¬†

entry.summary: Mino Games CEO Sasha MacKinnon, developer of the upcoming Dimensionals game, tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about the studio's approach to digital collectibles.

entry.title: Michael Wagner's 'Controversial Take' on Crypto in Games
entry.summary: At Solana's PlayGG, Star Atlas CEO Michael Wagner shares his "controversial take" on crypto in games, shares the challenges of developing the upcoming scifi game, and how crypto's volatility has changed his perspective with Decrypt's Jason Nelson.

entry.title: Interview: Angelic CEO on Building the Sci-Fi RPG on Solana and Ethereum
entry.summary: Angelic is a sci-fi roleplay game in development that will be free-to-play and offer optional, opt-in crypto features on Solana and Ethereum and a governance token. Metaverse Game Studios CEO and Founder Erkan Bayol tells Decrypt's Jason Nelson about how he sees AAA traditional games as Angelic's main competitors and shares his vision for the game.

entry.title: Apex Legends Voice Actor on AI's Impact on Video Games
entry.summary: Ben Prendergast is an actor who has voiced characters like Apex Legends' Fuse, God of War Ragnarok's Tyr, and Patroclus in Hades. But as debates swirl around the use of artificial intelligence in entertainment in light of the SAG-AFTRA and WGA strikes, Prendergast gives Decrypt's Kate Irwin his honest take on the potential use of AI actors in games.

entry.title: Star Atlas CEO on Developing an MMO Game
entry.summary: Decrypt's Jason Nelson speaks with Star Atlas Founder and CEO Michael Wagner about the MMO game's approach to development, marketing, and blockchain integrations.

entry.title: Aurory's Origin Story: How JRPGs Inspired the Games
entry.summary: Decrypt's Jason Nelson talks to Aurory's Head of Marketing and Business Development Michael Natoli about the origins of the Aurory crypto games at the Solana PlayGG event.

entry.title: Parallel TCG: Inside the Sci-Fi Card Game‚Äôs Closed Beta
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin goes hands-on with Parallel‚Äôs closed beta on Windows PC to find out what sets it apart from other crypto card-battlers.

entry.title: Web3 Games Need to Compete with All Games, Says Solana Foundation GM
entry.summary: Solana Foundation's General Manager of Games Johnny Lee tells Decrypt's Jason Nelson about Solana's PlayGG conference and shares his take on crypto gaming and the "play-to-earn" concept.

entry.title: Many Early Blockchain Games Were 'Cash Grabs,' Says Twitch Streamer Alliestrasza
entry.summary: "I wrote them off," Twitch streamer Alliestrasza said of her initial thoughts on many early blockchain games. She tells Decrypt's Jason Nelson about how her perspective on Web3 games has evolved over time and now sees blockchain games getting significantly better.

entry.title: 'MetalCore' Game Preview: Hands-on With the 'Titanfall' Meets 'Destiny' NFT Mashup
entry.summary: MetalCore is an upcoming mech shooter developed by Studio 369, and it's being developed on Ethereum scaling network Immutable zkEVM. Decrypt contributor Ryan Gladwin played through the prologue and tested out the recent Alpha 3 online experience to get a sense of the NFT-infused mashup of Titanfall and Destiny.
